*div1 type="summary"* *p*P. W. Grayson to James F. Perry, Monclova, September 16, 1834. State political confusion. Governor cooperating with the Texas ayuntamientos in behalf of Austin.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Monclova */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="09-16-1834">Sepr 16 34*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir,*/p*
*p*We reached here the *date_mentioned n="09-14-1834">day before yesterday*/date_mentioned*. I have found matters still in great disorders—the *person_mentioned*old Governor*/person_mentioned* abdicated and a new one elected, by a few persons here—*location_mentioned*Saltilla */location_mentioned*still holding out with her *person_mentioned*Governor */person_mentioned*besides as we understand—; a scene of things that no human being can unravel—*/p*
*p*We have no intelligence that can be relied on in regard to *person_mentioned*Col° Austin*/person_mentioned*,—There is a kind of rumor now, that he has escaped from *location_mentioned*prison*/location_mentioned*, but I place no confidence in it—*/p*
*p*We have delayed here, to get a memorial from the present *person_mentioned*Governor*/person_mentioned*, soliciting his discharge—We had an audience of*person_mentioned* his excellency */person_mentioned*to day, (A very polite, amiable looking old man) and had every assurance of his willingness to cooperate with the *person_mentioned*Texas Ayuntamientos*/person_mentioned*.—*person_mentioned*Padilla */person_mentioned*introduced us in a very cordial manner, and this evening he has informed us that he had made out the dispatches of the *person_mentioned*Governor */person_mentioned*would procure his signature in the morning, and hand then over to us—If the *location_mentioned*address of the Governor*/location_mentioned* should be as favorable as it is promised to be, it may be of much service—In the morning we shall start on our way*/p*
*p*There are various rumors in regard to *person_mentioned*Santa Anna*/person_mentioned*s plans—Some of them are very unfavorable—Time will tell which are true—I refer you to my letter of this date to *person_mentioned*Mr Bell*/person_mentioned* for the fuller account as to these rumors etc—being at the present moment a little pressed for time—*/p*
*p*I think now we shall meet with no further delay between this and *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*—*person_mentioned*Mr Jack*/person_mentioned* and myself are both in good health and everything considered, in pretty good spirits—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*P. W. Grayson*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*P. S. Please say to *person_mentioned*Mrs. Perry*/person_mentioned*, that I think (if my opinion is indeed of any value) that she need entertain no fears for the fate of her brother*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*P. W. G.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*We have received the memorial desired from the *person_mentioned*Governor */person_mentioned*and it is all we could wish—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*P. W. G.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*The old man *person_mentioned*Padilla */person_mentioned*has been very cordial and zealous—*/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="09-17-1834">Sept 17*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressdd:] *person_mentioned*Mr James F. Perry*/person_mentioned**location_mentioned* San Fellipe de Austin Texas*/location_mentioned* Care of *person_mentioned*Dock Miller*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Fellipe*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
